metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2785 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low.
metadata.Description:
There exists an arbitrary memory read within the Linux Kernel BPF - Constants provided to fill pointers in structs passed in to bpf_sys_bpf are not verified and can point anywhere, including memory not owned by BPF. An attacker with CAP_BPF can arbitrarily read memory from anywhere on the system. We recommend upgrading past commit 86f44fcec22c

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2785` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-10-generic - 5.19.0-18.18
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-generic - 5.19.0-18.18
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-generic-64k - 5.19.0-18.18
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-aws - 5.19.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-azure - 5.19.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-gcp - 5.19.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.19.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1005.5

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required
